Label: Editor-A 12 second, Low-Energy Particles, Geotail - T. Mukai (ISAS)

DatasetLink.Title: ISAS DARTS
DatasetLink.Text: 12-sec LEP plasma moments data supplied by and also available at

VariableDescription.Name: Ni
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Ion Density (qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           Geotail Magnetic Field
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     GEOTAIL>Geomagnetic tail
#     DATA_TYPE                       EDA12SEC>Editor-A 12 second
#     DESCRIPTOR                      LEP>Low-Energy Particles
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuouslyrecorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumpedover the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations
#                                     
#                                     Please use the Editor-A LEP dataset prior to the Editor-B LEP
#                                     dataset sinceplasma moments in the Editor-A data are more reliable.
#                                     (Plasma moments inthe Editor-B are calculated onboard.)
#                                     
#                                     The ion energy analyzer (LEP-EAi) has two energy scan mode:
#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.
#                                     (The LEP-EAi moments are presented by the solid lines in the plot.)
#                                     
#                                     The plasma moment data of the solar wind analyzer (LEP-SW) should be
#                                     used only qualitatively. The LEP-SW plasma moments are plotted
#                                     (listed) when the energy scan mode of LEP-EAi is RAM-B. (The
#                                     LEP-SW moments are presented by the dotted lines in the plot.)
#                                     J.Geomag.Geoelectr.,46,669,1994
#     MODS                            Created by R. McGuire on 9/1/2003; Adapted from GE_K0_LEP
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0087
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 ge_eda12sec_lep_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  ge_eda12sec_lep
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Editor-A 12 second, Low-Energy Particles, Geotail
#     PI_NAME                         T. Mukai
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  ISAS
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Plasma and Solar Wind
#     LINK_TEXT                       12-sec LEP plasma moments data supplied by and also available at
#     LINK_TITLE                      ISAS DARTS
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www.darts.isas.ac.jp/stp/geotail/ascii.html
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Geotail_LEP_Ion-Moments-EditorA_12sec_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Geotail
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     SPASE_DATASETRESOURCEID         spase://VMO/NumericalData/Geotail/LEP/EDA.PT12S
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Number of milliseconds since the epoch
#  2. Ion Density (qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:51:14 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Ion Density (qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#
EPOCH                                  ION_DENSITY_NI
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  1/cc_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW)
14-09-1993 13:45:09.966                     0.0220000

VariableDescription.Name: T
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Ion Temperature in Satellite coordinates (qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           Geotail Magnetic Field
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     GEOTAIL>Geomagnetic tail
#     DATA_TYPE                       EDA12SEC>Editor-A 12 second
#     DESCRIPTOR                      LEP>Low-Energy Particles
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuouslyrecorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumpedover the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations
#                                     
#                                     Please use the Editor-A LEP dataset prior to the Editor-B LEP
#                                     dataset sinceplasma moments in the Editor-A data are more reliable.
#                                     (Plasma moments inthe Editor-B are calculated onboard.)
#                                     
#                                     The ion energy analyzer (LEP-EAi) has two energy scan mode:
#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.
#                                     (The LEP-EAi moments are presented by the solid lines in the plot.)
#                                     
#                                     The plasma moment data of the solar wind analyzer (LEP-SW) should be
#                                     used only qualitatively. The LEP-SW plasma moments are plotted
#                                     (listed) when the energy scan mode of LEP-EAi is RAM-B. (The
#                                     LEP-SW moments are presented by the dotted lines in the plot.)
#                                     J.Geomag.Geoelectr.,46,669,1994
#     MODS                            Created by R. McGuire on 9/1/2003; Adapted from GE_K0_LEP
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0087
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 ge_eda12sec_lep_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  ge_eda12sec_lep
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Editor-A 12 second, Low-Energy Particles, Geotail
#     PI_NAME                         T. Mukai
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  ISAS
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Plasma and Solar Wind
#     LINK_TEXT                       12-sec LEP plasma moments data supplied by and also available at
#     LINK_TITLE                      ISAS DARTS
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www.darts.isas.ac.jp/stp/geotail/ascii.html
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Geotail_LEP_Ion-Moments-EditorA_12sec_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Geotail
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     SPASE_DATASETRESOURCEID         spase://VMO/NumericalData/Geotail/LEP/EDA.PT12S
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Number of milliseconds since the epoch
#  2. Ion Temperature in Satellite coordinates (qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:51:15 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Ion Temperature in Satellite coordinates (qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#
EPOCH                            ION_TEMP_TYY_(S/C)          ION_TEMP_TZZ_(S/C)
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  eV_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW) eV_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW)
14-09-1993 13:45:09.966                           9                          23

VariableDescription.Name: Sensor
VariableDescription.Header:

#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******

VariableDescription.Name: scan_code
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Energy Scan Code (1 = Sensor Code EA = energy scan mode RAM-A, 2 = Sensor Code SW = energy scan mode RAM-B)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           Geotail Magnetic Field
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     GEOTAIL>Geomagnetic tail
#     DATA_TYPE                       EDA12SEC>Editor-A 12 second
#     DESCRIPTOR                      LEP>Low-Energy Particles
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuouslyrecorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumpedover the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations
#                                     
#                                     Please use the Editor-A LEP dataset prior to the Editor-B LEP
#                                     dataset sinceplasma moments in the Editor-A data are more reliable.
#                                     (Plasma moments inthe Editor-B are calculated onboard.)
#                                     
#                                     The ion energy analyzer (LEP-EAi) has two energy scan mode:
#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.
#                                     (The LEP-EAi moments are presented by the solid lines in the plot.)
#                                     
#                                     The plasma moment data of the solar wind analyzer (LEP-SW) should be
#                                     used only qualitatively. The LEP-SW plasma moments are plotted
#                                     (listed) when the energy scan mode of LEP-EAi is RAM-B. (The
#                                     LEP-SW moments are presented by the dotted lines in the plot.)
#                                     J.Geomag.Geoelectr.,46,669,1994
#     MODS                            Created by R. McGuire on 9/1/2003; Adapted from GE_K0_LEP
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0087
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 ge_eda12sec_lep_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  ge_eda12sec_lep
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Editor-A 12 second, Low-Energy Particles, Geotail
#     PI_NAME                         T. Mukai
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  ISAS
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Plasma and Solar Wind
#     LINK_TEXT                       12-sec LEP plasma moments data supplied by and also available at
#     LINK_TITLE                      ISAS DARTS
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www.darts.isas.ac.jp/stp/geotail/ascii.html
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Geotail_LEP_Ion-Moments-EditorA_12sec_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Geotail
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     SPASE_DATASETRESOURCEID         spase://VMO/NumericalData/Geotail/LEP/EDA.PT12S
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Number of milliseconds since the epoch
#  2. Energy Scan Code (1 = Sensor Code EA = energy scan mode RAM-A, 2 = Sensor Code SW = energy scan mode RAM-B)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:51:16 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Energy Scan Code (1 = Sensor Code EA = energy scan mode RAM-A, 2 = Sensor Code SW = energy scan mode RAM-B)
#
EPOCH                          ENERGY_SCAN_CODE
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  (1=EA=RAM-A,2=SW=RAM-B)
14-09-1993 13:45:09.966                       1

#

#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments

#
#     TITLE                           Geotail Magnetic Field
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     GEOTAIL>Geomagnetic tail
#     DATA_TYPE                       EDA12SEC>Editor-A 12 second
#     DESCRIPTOR                      LEP>Low-Energy Particles
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuouslyrecorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumpedover the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations
#                                     
#                                     Please use the Editor-A LEP dataset prior to the Editor-B LEP
#                                     dataset sinceplasma moments in the Editor-A data are more reliable.
#                                     (Plasma moments inthe Editor-B are calculated onboard.)
#                                     
#                                     The ion energy analyzer (LEP-EAi) has two energy scan mode:
#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.
#                                     (The LEP-EAi moments are presented by the solid lines in the plot.)
#                                     
#                                     The plasma moment data of the solar wind analyzer (LEP-SW) should be
#                                     used only qualitatively. The LEP-SW plasma moments are plotted
#                                     (listed) when the energy scan mode of LEP-EAi is RAM-B. (The
#                                     LEP-SW moments are presented by the dotted lines in the plot.)
#                                     J.Geomag.Geoelectr.,46,669,1994
#     MODS                            Created by R. McGuire on 9/1/2003; Adapted from GE_K0_LEP
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0087
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 ge_eda12sec_lep_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  ge_eda12sec_lep
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Editor-A 12 second, Low-Energy Particles, Geotail
#     PI_NAME                         T. Mukai
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  ISAS
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Plasma and Solar Wind
#     LINK_TEXT                       12-sec LEP plasma moments data supplied by and also available at
#     LINK_TITLE                      ISAS DARTS
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www.darts.isas.ac.jp/stp/geotail/ascii.html
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Geotail_LEP_Ion-Moments-EditorA_12sec_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Geotail
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     SPASE_DATASETRESOURCEID         spase://VMO/NumericalData/Geotail/LEP/EDA.PT12S
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Number of milliseconds since the epoch
#  2. Geotail position in GSM cartesian coordinates
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:51:18 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Geotail position in GSM cartesian coordinates
#
EPOCH                           GEOTAIL_X(GSM)         GEOTAIL_Y(GSM)         GEOTAIL_Z(GSM)
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms                      Re                     Re                     Re
14-09-1993 13:45:09.966               -71.0400                21.8200               -6.71000

VariableDescription.Name: VSM
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Ion Velocity (SM) (qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           Geotail Magnetic Field
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science

#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Editor-A data are only acquired with the real-time operation in
#                                     Usuda Deep Space Center (UDSC),Japan, while the Editor-B data
#                                     are 24-hours continuouslyrecorded in the onboard tape recorders
#                                     and are dumpedover the NASA/JPL Deep Space Network (DSN) stations
#                                     
#                                     Please use the Editor-A LEP dataset prior to the Editor-B LEP
#                                     dataset sinceplasma moments in the Editor-A data are more reliable.
#                                     (Plasma moments inthe Editor-B are calculated onboard.)
#                                     
#                                     The ion energy analyzer (LEP-EAi) has two energy scan mode:
#                                     RAM-A (60eV to 40 keV) and RAM-B (5 keV to 40 keV).
#                                     The energy scan mode is automatically selected onboard depending
#                                     on the incoming ion fluxes. At present, only the plasma moments
#                                     in the RAM-A mode are plotted (listed) for the LEP-EAi data.
#                                     (The LEP-EAi moments are presented by the solid lines in the plot.)
#                                     
#                                     The plasma moment data of the solar wind analyzer (LEP-SW) should be
#                                     used only qualitatively. The LEP-SW plasma moments are plotted
#                                     (listed) when the energy scan mode of LEP-EAi is RAM-B. (The
#                                     LEP-SW moments are presented by the dotted lines in the plot.)
#                                     J.Geomag.Geoelectr.,46,669,1994
#     MODS                            Created by R. McGuire on 9/1/2003; Adapted from GE_K0_LEP
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0087

#              ************************************

#              ************************************
#
#  1. Number of milliseconds since the epoch
#  2. Ion Velocity (SM) (qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#

# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:51:18 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Ion Velocity (SM) (qualitative use only if Energy Scan Code = 2 = RAM-B/SW)
#
EPOCH                                    ION_VX_(GSM)                  ION_VY_(GSM)                  ION_VZ_(GSM)
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  km/s_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW) km/s_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW) km/s_(qual_only_if_scan=2=SW)
14-09-1993 13:45:09.966                           -80                             8                            19
